channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 09/08/25
item.content:encoded:
It’s time for all and sundry to give Battlefield 6 a go, with the beta going open today across PS5, Xbox and PC. Have you played it? What do you think about it?

In the News This Week

There was an Indie Direct stuffed with announcements for Switch this week, but plenty more going on in video games alongside.

  • Everything announced in the Indie World Direct – Mina the Hollower, Herdling, UFO 50 & more
  • Avalanche Studio’s Contraband is no longer in development for Microsoft
  • Heretic + Hexen get the Nightdive remaster treatment, and it’s out now!
  • Mario Party rival, LEGO Party, confirms September release date
  • Battlefield 6 and Black Ops 7 both need Secure Boot and TPM 2.0 for PC anti-cheat
  • Marathon expected to released by March 2026, as Bungie independence is “getting lighter”
  • Guitar Hero veterans form new studio as RedOctane returns
  • Marvel Tōkon: Fighting Souls PS5 Closed Beta announced for September
  • The Power Rangers and Halo Spartans blast some bugs in Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 4

Giveaways!

We’ve got a giveaway this weekend! With the space ninja cheerleader beat ’em up action of Ra Ra BOOM set to launch on 12th August, Gylee Games has given us ten copies of the game to giveaway to you all. Head here for all the ways to enter our Ra Ra BOOM giveaway, and good luck!

Games in Review & Featured Articles

Let’s start with the reviews, with a mix of big and indie, new and old, and some really interesting games.

  • Iwakura Aria – NSW, PC – 9/10
  • Vinebound: Tangled Together – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 8/10
  • A Dream About Parking Lots – PS5, XSX|S, NSW2, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 8/10
  • Heartworm – PC – 8/10
  • Two Point Museum: Fantasy Finds DLC – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Demon Slayer -Kimetsu no Yaiba- The Hinokami Chronicles 2 – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 7/10
  • Dungeons and Dragons Neverwinter Nights 2 Enhanced Edition – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 4/10

We also had a solitary hardware review for the GameSir X5 Lite mobile grip controller.

Beyond all the reviews, Dom went hands on with the Titan Quest 2 Early Access release and found a really enjoyable action RPG, and then kick flipped his BMX while delivering packages in Tanuki Pon’s Summer. I also got to go hands on with PowerWash Simulator 2, which is still a delightfully chill time.

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Battlefield 6, SkyCards and MindsEye.

Trailer Park

Mina the Hollower has a release date and a demo!

Herdling is shepherding its way out this month

Glaciered revealed for Switch

All five Jackbox Party Pack 11 games have now been revealed

Amon is Borderlands 4’s axe-chucking Vault Hunter, and here’s a gameplay overview

Your Achievements

What have you played this week?

  • Andrewww is back to Star Wars Jedi: Survivor, which has him hooked just as it’s about to leave PS Plus. “It’s a good mixture of fighting, exploration and environmental riddles, reminds me of some of the better (older) Tomb Raider games, just with a Star Wars story.”

That’s the round up for this week’s round up, enjoy the weekend and we’ll see you for more gaming gubbins on Monday.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/08/09/something-for-the-weekend-09-08-25/

item.title: Giveaway – Win cheerleader brawler Ra Ra BOOM for PS5!
item.content:encoded:
The AI apocalypse is upon us. Again. But that’s OK, because it’s giveaway time this weekend! With the beat ’em up Ra Ra Boom set to launch on 12th August, Gylee Games has kindly shared ten codes for PlayStation with us to dish out to a handful of lucky winners, so you can go and fight back against our would-be robot oppressors!

With the planet ruined by a rogue AI, there’s just one sanctuary for humanity left, and we’ve spent our time preparing… by training four carefully selected cheerleaders to become ninjas and shoot, smash and through the resurgent AI enemies.

Let’s hand over to our Ra Ra Boom preview from last month to meet our brawling foursome: “This is a classic beat ‘em up of the highest order, with four-player co-op giving you control of one of the four unique characters. They’re headed by Aris, a cheerleader who dual-wields Uzi-like machine guns, while my personal favourite Vee is the tank character, brutally pushing enemies back with her massive energy shield and chunky blows. Meanwhile, you’ve got Ren, a super-fast samurai, and last, but not least, Saida, a cyborg with sass. They’re described as ninja space cheerleaders and, broadly speaking, they are. They’re undoubtedly a cool and engaging group that you’ll want to take on an adventure smashing up robots.”

The game is launching for PS5, Xbox Series X|S and PC on 12th August, and we’ve got ten copies of Ra Ra Boom to giveaway for PlayStation (UK/EU region)


Win Ra Ra BOOM for PlayStation

Please note: This giveaway is for European digital codes, and so this giveaway is only open to UK and EU residents with a European PSN account. Ten winners will be selected at random, and they will win one copy of Ra Ra Boom for PlayStation 5. The competition closes at 13:00 UK time (BST) on Tuesday 12th August 2025. Winners will be contacted by email and must respond within three working days. Our standard terms and conditions apply.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/08/08/giveaway-win-cheerleader-brawler-ra-ra-boom-for-playstation/
